Chlapec s autizmom sa svojej mamy opýtal, či sa niekomu bude raz páčiť. Srdcervúca otázka obletela svet, ľudia mu posielajú odkazy
03 Nov 2019, 07:38 by Timea Krauszová

Povedzte Davidovi, že v Londýne má kamaráta aj rodinu, odkázal mu jeden pán.

Dvadsaťjedenročný David sa narodil svojim rodičom Kerry a Robertovi po tom, čo jeho mame lekári oznámili, že nebude môcť mať deti. Približne vo veku 4 rokov sa u neho začali prejavovať známky autizmu. Len donedávna ho rodičia sotva počuli utrúsiť jedno slovo, nieto celú vetu. Prvá ucelená otázka, ktorú sa David opýtal, však zlomila jeho mame srdce.
Musí študovať doma kvôli riziku infekcií
U Davida sa časom vyvinula porucha imunity, ktorá ho v podstate núti ostávať doma. Nechodí ani do školy, učí sa s mamou Kerry. Tá o ňom hovorí ako o svojom najlepšom kamarátovi. V hĺbke srdca ale vie, že David je osamotený.
„Viem, že je sám a že by chcel mať priateľov,“ povedala pre Buzzfeed News.
David nemá vyvinutú schopnosť komunikovať, na otázky odpovedá jednoslovne, je bežné, že niekoľko dní ani neprehovorí. Nedávno však prehodil prvú celú vetu vôbec, keď prehlásil, že sa mu páčia Jacksonville Jaguars (jeho obľúbený futbalový tím). Aby toho nebolo málo, neskôr za svojou mamou prišiel s nečakanou otázkou: „Aj ja by som sa niekomu páčil?“



Radosť z toho, že David opäť niečo povedal, si jeho mama Kerry nestihla poriadne užiť. Jej syn sa jej totiž opýtal, či sa niekomu môže páčiť tak, ako sa jemu páči jeho obľúbený futbalový tím. Predstava, že nad tým David počas svojich dní premýšľa, jej zlomila srdce. Musela sa z toho vyplakať vo voľných chvíľach. „Naozaj chce, aby ho niekto mal rád, chce mať kamarátov. Ale nevie, ako si ich nájsť,“ povedala pre Buzzfeed News.
Kerry sa pokúsila svojmu synovi vysvetliť, že ho nielenže milujú, ale sa im páči. Rovnako mu podľa Buzzfeed povedala, že sa páči Bohu, páčil sa jeho zosnulej babke a nepochybne sa zapáči každému, s kým by sa stretol. O svoj zážitok sa ako vždy podelila aj na sociálnej sieti Twitter. A odozva ju dojala.



Ľudia z celého sveta posielajú Davidovi odkazy, chcú sa s ním kamarátiť
 Jej príspevok sa rýchlo stal virálnym a získava množstvo odpovedí od ľudí, ktorí chcú, aby sa David a jeho rodičia cítili o čosi menej sami.
„Povedzte Davidovi, že má kamaráta v Londýne,“ píše muž s tromi deťmi, ktoré sa s ním tiež chcú kamošiť.



 „Tvoje fotky mi vyčarili úsmev na perách. Som si istá, že by si sa mi páčil,“ píše pani z Jordánska.



„Som si istá, že môjmu 19-ročnému synovi s autizmom by sa tiež páčil,“ pozdravuje Davida s rodinou ďalšia mamička s podobným osudom. Nie je jediná: aj sedemročný Lincoln, ktorý má tiež autizmus, ho pozdravil a chce byť jeho kamarát. Rovnako sa pridáva aj 16-ročný Nick a tiež Davidov 28-ročný menovec.












Kerry neskrývala dojatie, keď Buzzfeedu hovorila o tom, ako David tieto a mnoho ďalších reakcií prijal. „Boli sme hore celú noc a prečítala som mu každý príspevok. Ukazovala som mu odpovede, gifká a fotografie.“ David nehovoril veľa, zareagoval slovami „pekné“ a „milé“, no jeho mama vedela, že je šťastný: „Usmieval sa. Nikdy v živote som ho nevidela toľko sa usmievať,“ povedala pre Buzzfeed.
David sa za krásne reakcie stihol už na Twitteri aj poďakovať: napísal vlastný ďakovný odkaz, v ktorom píše: „Ďakujem vám za to, že sa vám páčim.“



Rodičia vyjadrili nádej, že možno sa raz nájde niekto, kto bude Davida nezištne milovať. Vedia, že mu nebudú môcť byť nablízku stále. Nateraz sa ale David zaoberá odpisovaním na každú jednu reakciu. „Nechce, aby sa niekto cítil vylúčený,“ vysvetlila pre Buzzfeed jeho mama a dodala, že odpisovanie asi potrvá celé mesiace.
Zároveň dúfa, že ich príbeh pripomenie ľuďom, že internet môže byť miestom pre dobré veci.

ĎALŠIE ČLÁNKY, KTORÉ BY ŤA MOHLI ZAUJÍMAŤ
text:
The boy with autism asked his mom if he would like someday. The heartbreaking question has enveloped the world, people are sending messages to it
03 Nov 2019, 07:38 by Timea Krausz

Tell David that he has a friend and family in London, one gentleman bequeathed.

David, twenty-one, was born to his parents Kerry and Robert after his mom's doctors announced he wouldn't be able to have children. At about 4 years of age, he began to show signs of autism. Until recently, his parents hardly heard him utter one word, not the whole sentence. But David's first comprehensive question broke his mother's heart.
They have to study at home because of the risk of infection
Over time, David developed an immune disorder that basically forces him to stay at home. She doesn't even go to school, she learns with her mother Kerry. She speaks of him as her best friend. But deep in his heart, he knows that David is alone.
"I know he is alone and would like to have friends," she told Buzzfeed News.
David does not have the ability to communicate, he answers the questions with one word, it is common for him not to speak for several days. Recently, however, he changed the first sentence at all when he said he liked the Jacksonville Jaguars (his favorite football team). To make matters worse, he later came to his mother with an unexpected question: "Would I like someone too?"



The joy of David saying something again did not make his mother Kerry really enjoy. Her son asked her if she might like someone the way she liked his favorite football team. The idea that David was thinking about it during her days broke her heart. She had to cry out of it in her spare time. “He really wants someone to like him, he wants to have friends. But she doesn't know how to find them, ”she told Buzzfeed News.
Kerry tried to explain to her son that they not only loved him, but they liked him. She also told him that she liked God, liked his late grandmother, and undoubtedly liked everyone he would meet. As always, she shared her experience on Twitter. And she moved her in response.



People from all over the world send messages to David, they want to be friends with him
Her contribution quickly became viral and receives many answers from people who want David and his parents to feel a little less alone.
"Tell David he has a friend in London," writes a man with three children who also wants to be friends with him.



“Your photos conjured up a smile on my lips. I'm sure you would like it, ”writes the Lady of Jordan.



"I'm sure my 19-year-old son with autism would also like it," says another mom with a similar fate to David and his family. It is not the only one: even seven-year-old Lincoln, who also has autism, greeted him and wants to be his friend. 16-year-old Nick and David's 28-year-old namesake are also added.












Kerry did not hide her emotions when Buzzfeedu talked about how David received these and many other reactions. “We were up all night and I read every post. I showed him answers, gifs and photographs. ”David didn't say much, he responded with the words“ nice ”and“ nice, ”but his mom knew he was happy:“ He was smiling. I've never seen him smile so much in my life, ”she told Buzzfeed.
David has already thanked Twitter for his beautiful reactions: he wrote his own thank-you note saying, "Thank you for enjoying me."



The parents expressed the hope that someday somebody might find someone to love David selflessly. They know they won't be able to be around him all the time. For the time being, however, David deals with depreciation for every single reaction. "He doesn't want anyone to be excluded," his mom explained to Buzzfeed, adding that depreciation would probably take months.
At the same time, they hope their story will remind people that the Internet can be a place for good things.
